input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Smoking has a direct effect on tar deposit. Tar deposit has a direct effect on lung cancer. For nonsmokers, the probability of lung cancer is 30%. For smokers, the probability of lung cancer is 51%. For smokers, would it be more likely to see lung cancer if the person had been a nonsmoker?
